Wisdom: الْكَذَّابُ مُتَّهَمٌ فِي قَوْلِهِ وَإِنْ قَوِيَتْ حُجَّتُهُ وَصَدَقَتْ لَهْجَتُهُ
enWisdom: The [one who is known to be a] incessant liar is suspected in his speech, even if his proof is strong and his tone is truthful

Wisdom: الْكَذَّابُ وَالْمَيِّتُ سَوَاءٌ فَإِنَّ [لِأَنَ‏] فَضِيلَةَ الْحَيِّ عَلَى الْمَيِّتِ الثِّقَةُ بِهِ فَإِذَا لَمْ يُوثَقْ بِكَلَامِهِ [فَقَدْ] بَطَلَتْ حَيَاتُهُ
enWisdom: The incessant liar and the dead are similar, for indeed (or because) the merit of the living over the dead is the ability to rely on him, so if his words are not reliable then [it is as if] his life is nullified

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِكَذُوبٍ أَمَانَةٌ وَلَا لِفَجُورٍ صِيَانَةٌ
enWisdom: There is no trustworthiness in an incessant liar and there is no safeguarding [from sin] in the morally corrupt
One who lies excessively is not believed

Wisdom: مَنْ عُرِفَ بِالْكَذِبِ قَلَّتِ الثِّقَةُ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who is known for lying, the trust [of others] in him decreases

Wisdom: مَنْ عُرِفَ بِالْكَذِبِ لَمْ يُقْبَلْ صِدْقُهُ
enWisdom: One who is known for lying, [even] his truth will not be accepted
There is no good in the knowledge of habitual liars
There is no good in the words of liars
